Test Name: Mycoplasma pneumoniae with Macrolide Resistance Reflex, Molecular Detection, PCR
Specimen Type: Respiratory samples (e.g., throat swabs, nasopharyngeal swabs, bronchoalveolar lavage)
Purpose: To detect Mycoplasma pneumoniae and associated macrolide resistance genes using PCR for accurate clinical diagnosis.
Equipment: Real-time PCR instrument, DNA extraction kit, PCR master mixes, pipettes with aerosol-barrier tips
